caption: We ordered through the Slice app cause of a promo code...otherwise no idea why this app is better than others that do the same...Slice of Brooklyn has a 4.8 rating on there and figure "okay should be good"  It wasn't, food arrived within a timely manner, however, we got the BBQ chicken pizza and garlic bread.  The garlic bread was hard as a rock and turned to dust upon touch cause it was so crispy...$4.50 wasted. The pizza was also cold, it looked like they just dumped a bottle of bbq sauce on cardboard with some moisture free $1.99 mozzarella from keyfoods and mini chucks of over cooked chicken which dried out in the oven...boom! labeled it pizza...transaction done...And the the crust was just ugh!  2 stars for delivery!
One of my favorite spots in Brooklyn the food is amazing and pizza is delicious, highly recommend hands down definitely the best in the area!!!! Keep up the great work guys👌.
Excellent thin crust pizza. We ordered Chix Parm and Ravioli's. It should be illegal how good it all was!

Absolutely terrible ! I ordered a pie half plain half pepperoni it wasn’t even freshly made there were slices they prob had out and threw it in a box to make a pie then i ordered a specific roll sausage pepperoni mozzarella and rigotta cheese i get it it has marinara sauce in it and the dough isn’t even cooked i call the guy won’t fix the order because he says i shoulda said no sauce why would i say no sauce if i told the person exactly what i want in the roll and never mentioned sauce he claims every roll comes with sauce ( which is not true) but be that as it may even if so i ordered a specific roll and told you what i wanted in it why would i have to say no anything when all that should have been put in it to begin with was what i said sausage pepperoni rigotta and mozzarella regardless of all this THE DOUGH ISNT EVEN COOKEDDDDD 🤣🤦‍♀️
Love taking my daughter here, who always wants to say hi to the staff. Good pizza and some nice deals if you buy a pie. We get one every few weeks.

Ordered a Sicilian from here a couple of days ago for delivery. It arrived cold and the crust and cheese—or what remained of it after a good amount of it stuck to the cardboard— were stiff. Rude man over the phone. Sad as this used to be one of my go to’s.
The pizza was good but nothing too amazing. Nice staff.
The workers are extremely nice, however the pizza has no flavor and just tastes like bread. Chicken roll is really mushy and flavorless aswell.

The pepperoni pizza is the best in the area- better than the one in Other parts of Brooklyn. I highly recommend! If you happen to be around Greenwood Cemetery, make sure to try the pizza from this pizzeria.  You won’t regret it!
The guy was nice but a slice for $2.50 at that quality is a no go. It's extremely thin and pretty flavorless. I would recommend eating a slice elsewhere.
(Translated by Google) Perfect excellent .. thank you  (Original) Perfecto excelente .. gracias
Good tasting pizza and very very friendly
Delivery times are unacceptable. Over an hour for 2 pies and they are less than five minutes from me.
The best pizza I have ever tasted. The employees were so friendly and kind. I'm so sad that I had to move away from this pizza place. Best pizza in Brooklyn.
Tried their pizza out for the first time and boy it's good. Loved every bite of it and would recommend anyone to order from here quick.
I had a wonderful time in this spot. We loved the great vibes and the menu. The staff are super welcoming. I am glad we finally managed to visit this spot.

Amazing customer service and delicious pizza! From the moment you enter this small pizzeria you are greeted with a lovely smile and a great pizza smell. The pepperoni pizza is the best in the area- better than the one in Other parts of Brooklyn. I highly recommend! If you happen to be around Greenwood Cemetery, make sure to try the pizza from this pizzeria.  You won’t regret it!
Person at the counter is touching food without wearing gloves - irresponsible.  His explanation “because I am ok”
Very good food and service
Not enough cheese on pizza

I was stuck at work and decided to order something to eat the first thing that comes in mind was pizza that wasone of  the best decisions I ever made pizza tasted so good omg couldn’t be more satisfied I give them 5 stars .
Great authentic NY pizza! Exactly what I was looking for.
Their pizza,and rolls are tasty better than most in Bklyn as their really not Italian ppl who own most of them in Bklyn.
Owner was awsome

Not a fan of this pizza. The crust(not just the end, the whole bottom of the pizza too) was thick as anything. Imagine a deep dish pizza with no sauce or cheese all crust. It was the equivalent to eating white bread. Pizza gets a two star cause the chicken was decent. The top is deceiving.
Great food
Great service

very average pizza.. i thought the star ratings would do it justice... if im being honest.. i only ate 2 slices of the medium pizza and threw the rest in the trash the next morning... just being honest...
Great Slice of Brooklyn 😁

Great customer service , kids friendly , real neighborhood pizzaria , but needs improvement on the pizzas Pizza should be more crusty and tomato salsa should be better taste , it Needs some update , I would be really said if our neighborhood pizzaria go away , but if don’t improve it will go
Dam good pizza

Ate here all three nights of my stay at The L Hotel. First of all, it’s the only place nearby to get food. Second of all, it was very good. Third, the staff was amazing, friendly and funny and cute. Definitely would eat here again.
These guys are always on point. Everything on the menu is delightful
Good pizza
Great pizza
The pizzas are amazing A great place to eat Staffs amazing 👌🏻
Pretty decent, if basic, cheese slices.
The best
Really good pizza!
The perfect NY pie.
Love the owner love the food and good lunch specials
The pizza is delicious
Good pizza
Try to eat here. Great.
Great  Kosher pizza at a fair price.  Family-friendly atmosphere and great service .
Decent prices. Personally I think the pasta is better than the pizza.
Just a plain old slice not very flavorful...
Good food
Really good pizza and very friendly staff. Was the perfect spot for a break from our tour around Brooklyn.
There's a thousand pizza joints in Brooklyn just like this and they're all perfect.
(Translated by Google) Place where we played some hands of Villar among friends  (Original) Lugar donde jugamos algunas manos de Villar entre amigos
Really good pizza
Fresh vegetables in calzone large portion at a great price I will definitely be back to have another taste of Brooklyn 's  greatest  slice
(Translated by Google) The worst pizza in Brooklyn.  (Original) La peor pizza en Brooklyn.
Loved the pizza... There was nothing left afterwards...
Tasty.
great
Nice people, nice nostalgic Brooklyn environment, and prices were well suited
Wow this place has great pizza. They have a broccoli and chicken slice that is soo yum. The garlic knots the best I've had. My family loves it here and the staff treats you like family. Its perfect.
Bruscetta pizza was awful and we threw it away. Pepperoni pizza was meh but at least we ate something. Definitely not ordering from there again
Friendly staff great service food is delicious Enjoy
Great food great people highly recommend this pizzeria to anyone I know best pizza in Brooklyn period. Can't wait to go back.

I love local pizza joints a lot more than any chain pizzeria. This place is great the staff is super friendly and kind. They are funny they remember you and they are happy to serve you. The food is delicious and I get my lunch from here fairly regular.
Excellent Pizza and Friendly owner.  Quick service and he will make up whatever kind of slice you want.  Better to eat here than inside Industry City and spend 4 times as much, I can tell you that!
Love the pizza
Great speciality slices and nice garlic knots, workers are nice people, come at least 3 times a month (considering I live in manhattan, that's a lot.)

First and only time i went was back in 2012 when I was driving otr. I saw the pizza in the display case and i thought they were just displays. Nope, I watched as she took a slice out and put it in the microwave, lol.
They always take care of me here. Pizza is really good.
Couldn't be more disappointed with the delivery/call service. We will defo write our honest opinion on our blog.

9.30pm, my husband and I were in NYC for the 5th day already and none of the comments about bad service and unpoliteness made much sense. But when I called slice of Brooklyn to order  a pizza, a man could not understand what I was asking, hung up on me and when I called twice again, he said it was closed. I had friends over and was about to order a whole bunch of food, but the rudeness stood out from any competition in NYC. Disappointed.
Great pizza in a tiny shop in Brooklyn. Yum yum nom.
Pick up is good price. Very reliable all around
Amazing 5 stars great staff great food very friendly.... service amazing
Pizza looked really old, like it had been sitting there inn the cold all day
Good pizzeria

I've added a star as I've tried more of their menu If possible order fresh to skip the slices. Don't love them but the fresh pies are pretty damn good. $6.50 lunch special for a personal pie. Plan ahead and do that. Sausage and peppers and lasagna also good

This place is the worst for pizza, the first time I let it slide but not again. Paying 12+ dollars and getting a pie that is this thin is a disgrace. I have been buying from them for many years, not any more
The best pizza in New York hands down...best customer service and always super clean ...love them
Really good Pizza  and  Philly cheese steak sandwich on garlic bread it's really good

Portions are good and food was good.  So good came back the next day for lunch. Small calzone was enough to split. Buffalo pizza was super yummy. Personal pizza for lunch was filling for my husband's appetite. Must try, they have everything on the menu.
So good they give it crunchy the bread spot but the pizza MUAH mama mia so good 😚😚😚😚
Good pizza, real nice guy
The pizza is a little thin plus it needs more sauce and  cheese but the workers there are nice
If your just hungry and need something quick . check this place
Friendly staff and best local pizza.
No bathroom. Tiny spot for a quick bite.
Excellent service, great 🍕
Great variety
Good deal on pizza
Awesome
It's an ok pizza

Ordered yesterday large pizza with mushrooms. The pizza wasn't good (my kids didn't finish even one slice, although they really like pizza), and the mushrooms weren't fresh but canned (?!). Will never order from that place again.

My first pizza experience in New York was nice. Very friendly staff and I was served a very greasy but satisfying slice. It wasn't the best I've had in my life, but I'd try it again with a little more parm.

Started working in Brooklyn recently and have eaten here a couple times. Their food is awesome. Their pizza is to die for, salads are huge and delicious, and their prices are fantastic (great lunch specials!). Highly recommend stopping here if you're in the area and want some yummy Italian food!
I like this place a lot. And the old man that runs the place has a good sense of humor. The garlic knots are to die for.

If you are in the neighborhood, it is an okay place for pizza and pasta. They offer a lunch special. The staff is always friendly. The prices are okay. Moderately priced. I had the pizza and a pasta dish.
I saw a guy blow into the pizza. I felt disgusted. This is a unlean and unsanitized place to eat good pizza.
Excellent pizza
